name: Finding Freedom - Workshop
description:
Finding Freedom: for those tired of fitting into boxes.
This is for anyone who’s ever felt stuck in an old version of themselves — the overachiever, the always-nice one, the fixer, the dependable friend.
You may not relate to those roles anymore, but they still follow you around.
This workshop is a chance to pause and ask: Who am I now? And what do I want to leave behind?
We’ll talk, write, and reflect. It’s not heavy therapy stuff — but it is honest, vulnerable, and maybe a little uncomfortable in the best way.
You’ll leave with a clearer sense of what you`re ready to outgrow, and what kind of freedom you`re craving next — at work, in relationships, in how you show up every day.
✨ This session is built on an exercise from my upcoming book on insecurities — so you`re getting early access to one of the most powerful tools I’ve created.
Come alone, or bring a friend. You`ll meet others in the middle of their own ‘figuring it out’ — and you just might feel less alone in yours.
No pressure. Just presence. Come as you are. No journaling experience needed.
🪑 Limited seats only (15 max)
🎟️ INR 350 & INR 250 (early bird offer)
📔 Please bring a notebook and pen along
Facilitator: Sonali Dutta, Founder of Youmanize.

name: Making My Storybook - Workshop for Children
description:
Colors for the characters, words for the story, plain white pages to be filled with your child’s creativity.
“Making My Storybook” is a hands-on book-making workshop for parents and their 3-5 year olds. This isn’t just doodles and colors, it’s a peek into your child’s world. A world shaped by everyday observations and experiences. This workshop opens up space for open-ended conversations with your child that may reveal cues about their interests, thoughts, and needs.
So, join us for an hour filled with colors, conversation, and creativity - and walk away with a storybook that’s uniquely yours.
Takeaways from this workshop:
- A storybook illustrated and authored by your child
- An hour of conversational creativity
- Insight into your child’s current interests and needs
- Moments of bonding and joy with your child

name: Oil Painting Workshop - Art Workshop
description:
Come, join me for an oil painting workshop. If this is your first dabble with paints, this fun and interactive step by step session is sure to keep you entertained, and provide the guidance for a canvas of your own creation. All the necessary materials will be provided. The only thing that you’re expected to bring along is your enthusiasm and art vibes.
Art is an expression of the inner self and the world around us as we perceive it. Oil paints provide beautiful rich textures and add depth and substance to the subject.
The essence of this session is to get together and create artistic strokes that unite us in a bond of communal love and creativity.

name: Hindustani Classical Vocal Classes - Weekly Classes
description:
Meet Simran, a Hindustani Classical Vocalist and Teacher whose life has been harmoniously entwined with music since childhood. Disciple of Smt. Divya Shenoy, Simran's voice masterfully blends traditional rigor with emotional depth.
For her, music is more than art – it's a sacred, boundless journey of devotion.
With a rich multidisciplinary background in dance, painting, poetry, and theater, her teaching approach is innately creative.
Join her at Atta Galatta every Tuesday, where music transcends melody, becoming a haven to listen, to express and to belong!
Classes will be on every Tuesday – 5 PM for children and 7 PM for adults. The monthly charges will be INR 2000 for one person. Trial classes available at INR 500 per class.

name: Qu For Quiz - Quiz
description:
The Qu for Quiz is based on a grid format with the grids formed by topics on one axis and level of difficulty (and hence the points) on the other. The topics could be varied like History, Sports, Music, Literature, Movies and more. A team of two members would get to choose a topic and the level of difficulty and the question would be revealed. The rest of the teams can go for the buzzer if they know the answer. Depending on the number of teams registering, the size of the grid would be decided. 
SAMPLE Qu: 2. The name is inspired by the traditional malt whisky distillation process in which malted barley was mixed by hand with shovels. This labor-intensive process often caused a shoulder injury to workers, causing their arms to hang low. Which brand is named thus?
Ganesh Balakrishnan is an entrepreneur, marketer and creator of terrible dad jokes. His claim to fame is attempting to sell shoes during the pandemic, culminating in a viral Shark Tank "Down But Not Out" appearance. He is a collector of useless facts since childhood, and has dabbled in trivia quiz circuits since college. ganesh.flatheads@gmail.com
Karthik Srinivasan is a pseudo-retired software leader by choice, specializing in innovative ideas to spend time that include organizing cricket leagues at the scale of IPL but for free, staying up to date on latest debates in virtual social groups helmed by family and friends and more on similar lines. emailkarth@gmail.com

name: Letters to Dadu: A Storytime for Hearts Big and Small - Storytelling
description:
Join author Aprajita Singh for a warm and engaging storytelling session based on her picture book Summers with Dadu. Set in the world of mangoes, memories, and mischief, this session invites children (and grown-ups!) to relive the magic of holidays spent with grandparents and heartwarming connections across generations.
Come be part of a fun-filled morning of stories, art and writing for the grandparents near and far!

name: We Fed the Whale A Greenhouse - Book Discussion
description:
The AG Lit Sisters invite you to an intimate evening with award-winning journalist and debut author Sonali Prasad, as we dive into her lyrical and poignant novel Glass Bottom, a story of two pairs of mothers and daughters who reside by the sea, navigating the silent intensity of love, loss, legacy, and everything in between.
Set against the shifting tides of the coastline, Glass Bottom offers a tender meditation on relationships, memory, and healing. In this special session, Sonali will read a short excerpt from the novel, followed by a heartfelt Q&A and book discussion with readers.
📚 Hosted by AG Lit Sisters
🎤 In collaboration with Pan Macmillan India
Whether you're drawn to stories that stir your soul or conversations that linger long after they end, this is a session you won’t want to miss.
SONALI PRASAD was born and raised in New Delhi, India. Her journalism has appeared in publications such as the Guardian, Washington Post, Hakai Magazine, Quartz and Esquire Singapore. She has been awarded a Pulitzer Traveling Fellowship, Global TED Fellowship, MIT Knight Science Journalism
Fellowship, Logan Science Journalism Fellowship and a Jan Michalski Writing Residency, among other grants and honours.
Glass Bottom is her first book.
performer:
Dr. Chhavi Gandhi Juneja, 
Sonali Prasad,

name: Food In Indian Literature - Monthly Book Club
description:
Our emotions and memories are intrinsically related to the food we eat and the genre of food literature combines them in a way that helps us connect not only to our past and our present, to different cultures, and communities, values and rituals, events both life-changing and mundane but to each other as well.
So, if viewing the world through the lens of food and literature interests you, then join us to begin a dialogue on “Food in Indian Literature” and to celebrate those stories and their diversity. Each month with Prachi Grover, we will be reading our way through several powerful (and delicious) narratives.
August Read: Eating Women, Telling Tales by Bulbul Sharma
We assure you that you will enjoy every single bite!
The session is free but registration is a must as we have limited spots available.
Prachi Grover is a culinary consultant and educator and is the founder of “From Words to Wok”; a community for people who to love to read and eat!

name: Queer Quiet Hours - Meetup
description:
The next dates for Queer Quiet Hours are here!  
Queer Quiet Hours is back — a cozy space to rest, make art, and just be. No pressure to talk, no need to perform. Just soft community vibes and gentle company. Bring your own project or come as you are. We'll have plenty of art stuff for you to use.
✨ For LGBTQIA+ folks only. We haven't opened it up to allies yet.

🆓 Free to join. Limited spots.

📸 No photos taken without clear consent.

Spots are limited - Sign up!
